question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Darryl A Wesener's employer in 2046?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Here is a potential Wikipedia entry:

Darryl A. Wesener

Darryl A. Wesener is a researcher who has made significant contributions to his field. One notable aspect of his career is his affiliation with the University of Wisconsin–Madison. Affiliation with University of Wisconsin–Madison

Darryl A. Wesener has worked for the University of Wisconsin–Madison, a public research university located in Madison, Wisconsin, USA. This affiliation is supported by multiple credible sources. According to his profile on ResearchGate, a social networking site for scientists and researchers, Wesener lists the University of Wisconsin–Madison as one of his affiliations. [1] Additionally, a search of the university's directory reveals Wesener's name and contact information, further confirming his association with the institution. [2]

Furthermore, Wesener has co-authored several research papers with other scholars affiliated with the University of Wisconsin–Madison, suggesting a collaborative relationship with the university. [3][4] These papers have been published in reputable academic journals, adding to the credibility of Wesener's affiliation with the university. References:

[1] Wesener, D. A. (n.d.). ResearchGate Profile. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.researchgate.net\/profile\/Darryl_Wesener>

[2] University of Wisconsin–Madison. (n.d.). Directory Search. Retrieved from <https:\/\/directory.wisc.edu\/>

[3] Wesener, D. A., & Johnson, K. (2018). Title of Research Paper. Journal of Research, 10(2), 123-145. doi: 10.1016\/j.jr.2018.02.001

[4] Smith, J., Wesener, D. A., & Lee, S. (2020). Title of Research Paper.
content.source_2: In the year 2035, the city of Paris was abuzz with excitement as the Sorbonne University, a prestigious institution born from the merger of two esteemed universities, celebrated its 17th anniversary. Amidst the festivities, a brilliant researcher named Darryl A. Wesener was about to embark on a new chapter in his career. On October 11th, 2035, Darryl walked through the historic gates of Sorbonne University, eager to contribute his expertise to the institution's esteemed faculty. As he settled into his new role, Darryl was struck by the university's vibrant atmosphere, where cutting-edge research and innovation seemed to seep from every stone. He quickly became an integral part of the community, collaborating with colleagues from diverse backgrounds and disciplines. His groundbreaking work in his field soon earned him recognition, and he found himself at the forefront of several high-profile projects. The years flew by, with Darryl's research yielding remarkable breakthroughs that resonated far beyond the university's walls. He became a sought-after speaker, sharing his insights at conferences and symposia around the world. As the seasons changed, Darryl's reputation continued to grow, and he was increasingly regarded as a leading authority in his field. As the autumn of 2044 approached, Darryl reflected on the incredible journey he had undertaken at Sorbonne University. Nine years had passed since he first joined the institution, and he had accomplished more than he ever thought possible. On November 7th, 2044, Darryl bid farewell to the university, leaving behind a legacy of innovation and discovery that would continue to inspire generations to come. As he walked out of the university gates for the last time, Darryl felt a sense of pride and accomplishment wash over him. He knew that his time at Sorbonne University had been a defining period in his life, one that had shaped him into the researcher he was today. The memories of his time at the university would stay with him forever, a testament to the power of collaboration, innovation, and the pursuit of knowledge. In the years that followed, Darryl's work continued to have a profound impact on his field, and his name became synonymous with excellence and innovation.
